Row.Text: Advanced Mechanized Infantry
Incredibly fast and powerful, this late-game Unit require Aluminum to be built.

Advanced Mechanized Infantry are stronger and faster than Mechanized Infantry. In addition to fast, Advanced Mech Infantry move after combat like Modern Armor and can heal even we in make an action; A mix between the Infantry and the armored vehicles.

Unit powered with exoskeleton, also known as powered armor, or exoframe, is a powered mobile machine consisting primarily of an exoskeleton-like framework worn by a person and a power supply that supplies at least part of the activation-energy for limb movement. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]These depictions can be described as a battlesuit with mechanical and electronic mechanisms designed to augment the wearer's abilities. Other power armors are portrayed as being much larger, more like a bipedal vehicle the size of a tank or much larger. The line between mecha and power armor is necessarily vague.
Computer Networks
Computer Networks

The advancement of computing systems has increasingly resulted in their distribution across a wider network of computers. Parallel processing allows computations to be conducted more quickly, as various calaculations can be carried out simultaneously, while distributed computer networks create systems that are more flexible and resilient against mechanical failure, as they are no longer limited to single machines.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Vertols[ENDCOLOR], a hovering military unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Research Servers[ENDCOLOR] which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"All of a sudden, we've lost a lot of control. We can't turn off our internet; we can't turn off our smartphones; we can't turn off our computers." -- Steve Wozniak[NEWLINE][TAB]
Environmentalism
Environmentalism

The increasing awareness of ecological systems and how they work has, in turn, lead to concerns about the impact of human activity upon them. Environmentalism is a broad social movement that emphasizes environmental protection and the health of the environment. It advocates for the lawful preservation, restoration, and improvement of the natural environment, and typically seeks to control pollution and encourage natural diversity.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Geothermal Plants[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tidal Plants[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nature Preserves[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We have lived our lives by the assumption that what was good for us would be good for the world. We have been wrong. We must change our lives so that it will be possible to live by the contrary assumption, that what is good for the world will be good for us. And that requires that we make the effort to know the world and learn what is good for it." -- Wendell Berry[NEWLINE][TAB]
Augmented Reality
Augmented Reality
High-Energy Physics
High-Energy Physics
The field of high energy physics is guided by intertwined science drivers to explore the elementary constituents of matter and energy, the interactions between them, and the nature of space and time.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Railgun Armor[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Feedsite Nodes[ENDCOLOR]. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Generators[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Physics is the only profession in which prophecy is not only accurate but routine."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Neil deGrasse Tyson[NEWLINE][TAB]
Orbital Development

While national governments still have the most resources to invest in space exploration, commercial enterprises have become increasingly interested in the opportunities of privatized access to space. Either way, orbital development holds opportunities for both research and industrial production, as well as helping facilitate and maintain increasingly complex orbital communication networks.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mycoprotein Vats[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_FOOD] Food production, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Space Stations[ENDCOLOR] to increase the number of Specialists in a city.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The exploration and use of outer space,including the moon and other celestial bodies, shall be carried out for the benefit and in the interests of all countries, irrespective of their degree of economic or scientific development, and shall be the province of all mankind."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Article 1 of the Treaty on Principles Governing the Activities of States in the Exploration and Use of Outer Space, Including the Moon and Other Celestial Bodies[NEWLINE][TAB]
Implants
Implants

As the methods of genetic manipulation become increasingly refined, the possibiilty of using genetics to produce more effective organs and organic components increases. While the wholescale manipulation of the human genome would produce more effective results, the sheer complexity of the task makes it easier to focus on engineering organic components to specific standards, even if the rest of the host body suffers significant problems. While there are some concerns about the ethics of using these engineered host bodies to incubate augmented organs, they do prove to be increasingly valuable and useful, whether in enhancing the productivity and effectiveness of workers, or in making more powerful soldiers for the battlefield.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biodrones[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organic Infantry[ENDCOLOR], futuristic units that can heal themselves, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Implant Clinics[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"And he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark in their right hand, or in their foreheads: And that no man might buy or sell, save he that had the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Revelations, the Bible[NEWLINE][TAB]
Neural Interface
Neural Interface

As machines have become increasingly sophisticated, the interfaces required to interact with them have as well. Being able to control a machine with one's thoughts as an extension of one's body would be an incredible achievement, making it far simpler to perform complex tasks with mechanical assistance. However, the brain is itself a highly complex organ, and achieving a direct interface a significant challenge. Still, progress is being made in establishing connections between computers and other technological devices and human nerves, allowing both motor control and sensory input of technological devices.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Network Backbones[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cyberclincs[ENDCOLOR] to increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nodes[ENDCOLOR], which increase the combat strength of nearby units.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A picture is worth a thousand words. An interface is worth a thousand pictures."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ben Shneiderman[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cognitive Technology
Cognitive Technology

As the capability to produce increasingly small-scale devices develops, so has the capacity to integrate computer systems into practically any item or material, and with the development of networked computing, allows appliances or other objects to be made increasingly "smart". A smart home, for example, can monitor activity in various rooms, adjusting lighting or temperature as needed to conserve power. Smart appliances can monitor usage and even determine when to place orders for new food or other supplies as needed. Furthermore, even simple "smart" systems acting in concert can display increasingly intelligent emergent behavior.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cybersubs[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced submarine unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Autoplants[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Undersea Mining[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Digital behavior is just a replication of human behavior."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Paul Papadimitriou[NEWLINE][TAB]
Microscale Engineering

The development of nanomaterials demonstrated that it is possible to manipulate matter on molecular and even atomic scales to produce new materials and structures. The next challenge in the search of true nanotechnology is to produce actual working components on this scale -- power sources, motors, and other mechanical parts to allow nanoscale machines to undertake tasks. Increasingly sophisticated tools are devised to allow the manipulation of molecules on the nanoscale level, which in turn makes sophisticated and futuristic materials much more common and available.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Drone Fighters[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hypervelocity Missiles[ENDCOLOR], the most sophisticated airborne units in the game, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Converters[ENDCOLOR] to produce more [ICON_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Infinities and indivisibles transcend our finite understanding, the former on account of their magnitude, the latter because of their smallness; Imagine what they are when combined."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Galileo Galilei[NEWLINE][TAB]
Gengineering

While the genetic modification of the human genome holds the most promise for human augmentation, it is a highly complex endeavor as the human genome is the product of millions of years of evolution. A simpler undertaking is to take much simpler genomes, such as those found in plants and animals, in order to modify them more drastically -- or even produce entirely new genomes. In time, experimentation with genetic manipulation lead to the capability to craft and engineer entirely new organisms, leading to the term "gengineering", a portmanetau of the term "genetic engineering". With the capbility to engineer living organisms to fill specific ecological niches and other roles, it becomes increasingly possible to manipulate the environment to meet particular needs or desires.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Chimeras[ENDCOLOR], genetically engineered combat units, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biogenesis pods[ENDCOLOR] which increase the production of certain units, and provide newly created units with unique promotions.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to. If you are not afraid of dying, there is nothing you cannot achieve."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching[NEWLINE][TAB]
Biomodification

While the term "gengineering" refers to the creation of entirely new organisms through genetic manipulation, biomodification reflects taking existing organisms and modifying them to improve their capabilities in various ways. In particular, modification of the human genome allows the adaptation of individuals to augmented forms that can meet a variety of needs, whether it be strength and durability in combat, or the ability to work in hazardous environments. As biomodfication becomes increasingly prevalent, more environments become available to humans to live and work, although the definition of what constitutes being "human" starts to become blurred.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biotroopers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful genetically-engineered infantry, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biofactories[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"As human beings, our only sensible scale of values is one based on lessening the agony of existence."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - H.P. Lovecraft[NEWLINE][TAB]
Artificial Environments

Manned exploration and inhabitation of outer space will require significant advances in the technologies available to sustain humans in one of the most hostile environment possible. In particular, self-sustaining environments that can provide breathable atmosphere, drinkable water, and food will be needed. These technologies will not be applicable only to space travel, however, as it will enable us to create self-contained environments underground, in arid regions, or under the ocean, greatly increasing the volume of space available for human habitation.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Vivariums[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hydroponics Domes[ENDCOLOR] in order to increase [ICON_FOOD] Food output, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Geofronts[ENDCOLOR] to improve city defense.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The more artificial a human environment becomes, the more the word 'natural' becomes a term of value."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Wendell Berry[NEWLINE][TAB]
Adamantium

As atomic nuclei grow larger, the binding energy that holds them together becomes weaker, making heavier elements unstable and prone to radioactive decay. However, it is predicted that certain superheavy nuclei (with approximately 300 nucleons) would achieve stability as the nucleons are arranged in more stable configurations. Generating such atoms is a difficult challenge, however, as even the nuclei that could be fused to achieve such elements are in rare supply, and incredible amounts of energy and precision would be required to synthesize them. However, the advent of fusio power plants and the precision engineering required to manufacture nanoscale machines do make it a possibility, and such superheavy elements would be valuable as both a raw material and as a potential power source.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Giant Death Robots[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful combat unit in the game, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nucleonic Foundries[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_NANOMAT] Nanomaterials.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The tricky thing about adamantium is, that if you ever manage to process its raw, liquid form, you got to keep it that way, keep it hot. Because once the metal cools, it's indestructible."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - X-Men[NEWLINE][TAB]
Arcologies

The term 'arcology' is a portmaneteau of the words 'architecture' and 'ecology', and is a vision of architectural design principles for very densely populated habitats. An arcology is distinguished from a merely large building in that it is designed to lessen the impact of human habitation on any given ecosystem. Adapting to life within an arcology would likely require social and cultural adaptation as well, with an increased emphasis on frugality and shared social resources, and a lessening of private space.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arcologies[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Feedsite Hub[ENDCOLOR], which increases [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Architecture is the physical form of the ecology of the human, the configuration of matter which allows for the best energetic and willful flux"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Paolo Soleri[NEWLINE][TAB]
Artificial Intelligence
Artificial Intelligence

Artifical intelligence is the intelligence exhibited by machines and software. Although technically any intelligent agent is one that can perceive its environment and undertake actions that maximize its chances of success, colloquially the term refers to a machine or software that displays a notable degree of self-awareness and sentience, displaying a human-like level of intelligence. With the development of "smart" devices and other forms of cognitive technology, achieving this goal becomes a possibility, although there are some concerns that, as such intelligences may not think in a truly "human" fashion, they may become rivals or otherwise hostile towards humanity. Still, as intelligent behavior may be defined as being logical or human-like, it is also possible such new intelligences would be benevolent or friendly towards humanity, so long as humanity acted intelligently themselves.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Robot Infantry[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced infantry unit in the game, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Drone Hive[ENDCOLOR], which increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I think, therefore I am"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Rene Descartes[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cybernetics
Cybernetics

Although cybernetics as a science is broadly concerned the study of systems of any nature which are capable of receiving, storing, and processing information so as to use it for control, its study of the connection between stimulus and action lends itself to the common perception of the study of interfaces between humans and machines, and how mechanical sensors and agents might be integrated with human decision-making processes. However, cybernetics can also be applied to such things as purely mechanical systems (studying artificial intelligence and emergent behavior), as well as biological and social systems.
Enables construction of Mecha units.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The world of the future will be an even more demanding struggle against the limitations of our intelligence, not a comfortable hammock in which we can lie down to be waited upon by our robot slaves." -- Norbert Weiner[NEWLINE][TAB]
Ecosophy
Ecosophy

While environmentalism has been a social movement concerned with the preservation of nature against human activity, it does also have the drawback of regarding both "nature" and "humanity" as separate and distinct from each other. As the study of ecological systems progresses, increasing movements that seek to view both humans and their environment more holistically start to develop, encouraging people to view themselves as part of a single, unified system. Some of the more radical proponents of these new ecological philosophies (or "ecosophies") advocate that thought should be given to modifying both humans and the environment so they can live in greater harmony with each other -- with competing needs, simply preserving both humanity and the environment as they are is likely to lead to further conflict.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transgenic Nurseries[ENDCOLOR] which improve Forests, Jungles, and Marshes, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ecosanctuaries[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Every living being is connected intimately, and from this intimacy follows the capacity of identification and as its natural consequences, practice of non-violence."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Arne Næss[NEWLINE][TAB]
Nanomaterials
Nanomaterials

Nanomaterials research takes a materials science-based approach to nanotechnology, leveraging advances in materials metrology and synthesis which have been developed in support of microfabrication research. Materials with structure at the nanoscale often have unique optical, electronic, or mechanical properties.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Power Armor Infantry[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic infantry unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nanomaterial Plants[ENDCOLOR] which provide Nanomaterials.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Carbon atoms on a distant planet rearranged themselves into DNA, microorganisms formed, grew backbones, swam around the ocean, mutated into amphibians and crawled onto dry land — and finally a cab appeared at the mouth of the alley."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mark Coggins, "The Immortal Game"[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cloning
Cloning

The advancing study of biology and medicine lead to the creation of methods for artifical gestation, and manipulation of organisms on a cellular level. Once the ability to incubate organisms artifically in a laboratory environment was achieved, attention was turned to the capability to replicate particularly useful organisms, eventually leading to the search for some means to replicate an actual human being. Still, while it is possible to replicate an organism genetically, that organism may not mature into an identical twin of its predecssor, due to environmental influences.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mutants[ENDCOLOR], a cheap infantry unit that can heal itself, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Clone Labs[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aquaculture Labs[ENDCOLOR], which enhance nearby resources.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Why would you clone people when you can go to bed with them and make a baby? C'mon, it's stupid."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ray Bradbury[NEWLINE][TAB]
Genetic Manipulation
Genetic Engineering

With the discovery of DNA, and the increasing ability to manipulate organisms on a genetic level, it was inevitable that some would investigate the effects of manipulating the genetic composition of organisms, in an effort to improve them in various ways. Genetic manipulation can be highly problematic, however, as even simpler organisms that have been genetically modified may prove to have unintended biological and environmental effects. The possibility of human genetic modification is an issue with many social and ethical concerns, although some feel the potential benefits would outweigh such risks.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gene Labs[ENDCOLOR], which provide a bonus to certain resources, as well as increasing the production of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot become what we need to be, remaining what we are."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Max De Pree[NEWLINE][TAB]
Memetics
Memetics

Memetics is the study of the development and spread of memes -- self-contained units that carry cultural ideas, symbols, or practices that can be transmitted from one mind to another. They are considered by some to be a cultural analogue to genes, in the way they replicate, mutate, and respond to selective pressures. The study of memetics may help us understand how societies and cultures develop and evolve over time, although some suggest it may ultimately also help people manipulate and shape socieities into more desirable forms.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Entertainment Servers[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]VR Training Centres[ENDCOLOR] to help train veteran units.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Not even the most heavily-armed police state can exert brute force to all of its citizens all of the time. Meme management is so much subtler; the rose-tinted refraction of perceived reality, the contagious fear of threatening alternatives."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Peter Watts, Blindsight[NEWLINE][TAB]
Mecha
Mecha

The maturation of nanoengineering and the incredible power supply of fusion reactors finally enabled a long-time dream of science fiction fans -- the development of anthropormorphic battle vehicles, coloquially termed "mecha".
Enables construction of Mecha units.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"What? Metal Gear??"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Solid Snake[NEWLINE][TAB]
Hyperstructures
Hyperstructures

Expanding upon the concept of the arcology towards urban development, advances in materials engineering and other technologies may someday make it feasible to accomplish tremendous feats of engineering -- housing an entire city of people in a single structure, designed to optimize human comfort and society while minimizing their impact on the surrounding environment. Such a structure would be a tremendous accomplishment, and would undoubtably have an equally great impact upon human society.
Enables the construction of Mega Buildings
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men have become the tools of their tools"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - David Thoreau [NEWLINE][ TAB ]
Microscale Engineering

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Infinities and indivisibles transcend our finite understanding, the former on account of their magnitude, the latter because of their smallness; Imagine what they are when combined."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Galileo Galilei[NEWLINE][TAB]
Homo Superior
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I teach you the Overman. Man is something which shall be surpassed."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Friedrich Nietzsche[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the full maturation of both biomodfication and cybernetics, it becomes possible to augment the human body in almost limitless ways. Human beings can be stronger, smarter, live longer and be relatively free from disease or injury. While there are ethical and even logistical concerns with such human augmentation, it would leave humanity poised to transcend its limitations.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Stasis Chamber[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Digital Society
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you stay right where you are, then people will eventually come to you."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Robert Doisneau[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the proliferation of artificial intelligences, as well as the advancement of cybernetics allowing humans to utilize mind-machine interfaces and telepresence, the concept of the mind and personality being linked to one's physical body becomes increasingly outmoded. Advances in computer networks and technology allow people to project themselves anywhere on the planet, or perceive entirely artifical worlds. Ultimately, such a society may discard concerns about the physical world, with identity being determined solely by one's mind, rather than one's body, and one's perceptions may be determined largely by one's interactions with the electronic environment humanity lives in.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Simulation Servers[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Smart Materials
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Everything changes, nothing remains without change."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Siddhārtha Gautama[NEWLINE][TAB]

The culimination of nanotechnology would be the development of "smart materials" -- materials that are actually comprised of intelligent nanomachines, capable of adapting themselves to their environments or other stimuli. Nanomachines like these, working in concert, would allow humans to have complete control over their environments -- construction shelters or other objects upon demand. Depending on the nature and distribution of the nanomachines, they could also serve other roles, such as personal defense or even transportation.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Utility Fog[ENDCOLOR], which improves city defense and increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Energy Theory
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Nikola Tesla [NEWLINE][ TAB ]
The human investigation of the principles under which the universe operates have lead to investigations of the functioning of the universe at the smallest and most high-energy states.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Boosters[ENDCOLOR], one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Moon Base[ENDCOLOR].
Terraforming
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Man does not weave this web of life. He is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Chief Seattle[NEWLINE][TAB]

Mankind has always sought to control and defend itself against the ravages of its environment, developing clothing and shelter to protect ourselves, and eventually finding ways to turn it to our advantage. But as we've learned to control humanity, we've also become aware of the impact we ourselves have upon the world around us. The culimination of this development may be the eventual development of means of terraforming -- transforming the entire environment around us as needed. Manipulating plants, animals, and terrain, we could adapt new planets to become habitable, or adjust our own to become more tolerable.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Utility Fog[ENDCOLOR], which improves city defense and increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Space Colonization
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"There is no easy way to the stars from the earth."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Seneca [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Humanity has always felt an underlying desire to explore and expand, to find what lies beyond the horizon. Outer space provides the ultimate frontier, a broad expanse that humanity can expand into and explore. The achievement of a level of technology that would permit humans to travel to another star system may be as pivotal in human history as the development of the first tools.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Engine[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Computronium
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - George Orwell [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Computronium is a material hypothesized by Norman Margolus and Tommaso Toffoli of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to be used as "programmable matter," a substrate for computer modeling of virtually any real object.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Cockpit[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Human Augmentation

[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Mind you, I've always wondered if Kei wasn't one of those Yamashita upgrades -- you know, with too much adrenocorticotropic hormone, too little monoamine oxidase?"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Adam Warren, A Plague of Angels [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

With the development of both genetic biomodification and cybernetics, limitless possibilities for human augmentation became possible. Virtually any component of the human body could be replaced with a vat-grown or cybernetic replacement. Eventually, however, some began to see baseline humanity as the limitation, as it could only accept so much modification, and more experimentation began on establishing improved versions of the human genome.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Birthing Pods[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Cloning Lab
Increases the benefits from [ICON_RES_COW] Cows, [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep, and [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep and +1 Production from [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses and [ICON_RES_COW] Cows.

The earliest experiments in cloning were conducted on farm animals. As human cloning has a variety of ethical concerns, the most likely uses of cloning in the near future will be to increase the productivity of animal herds.
Aquaculture Lab
Sea resources worked by the city produce +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Requires a Lighthouse, and city must not contain an Undersea Mining Platform.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold from sea resources.

As various scientific methods were used to improve crops and animal herds, it was inevitable that similar techniques would be applied to increasing the availability of animals that lived in the sea. Various experimentation in 'aquaculture' has lead to various methods of maximizing the yields that can be gained from the various animals in the sea.
Gene Lab
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas, and [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish. Increases rate of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People production by 25%
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas, and [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish. Increases the speed at which [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People are generated in the city by 25%

As techniques to manipulate genetic information were improved, experimentation upon a wider range of subjects began. New crops and animals were developed as a response to increasing issues of food supplies.
Transgenic Nursery
Improves the yields from Forests, Jungles, and Marshes.
Forest, Jungle, and Marsh tiles produce an extra 1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION].

Studies of the spread of genetically modified plants and animals in existing ecosystems, combined with refinements in genetic modification and engineering, lead to increased efforts to expand beyond just modifying individual organisms, but to entire ecosystems. Transgenic nurseries were used as preliminary test environments to develop new, self-sustaining ecologies that grew more effectively and were more productive than naturally-ocurring ones. Once satisfactory results had been achieved, these new ecosystems were introduced into the wild, quickly supplanting the existing ones.
Biogenesis Pod
Increases the production of Chimeras, Mutants, Organic Infantry and Biotroopers. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Gengineered promotion.
Increases the production of Chimeras, Mutants, Organic Infantry and Biotroopers. Melee, Gun, Ranged, and Scout units receive the Gengineered promotion.

As the creation and even mass production of artificially-engineered genetic chimeras became more common, so did facilities dedicated to the task. Biogenesis pods were the most integral component in these facilities, as they allowed genetic manipulation of chimeras even during the incubation process, so that they could be dynamically adjusted to meet varying needs. These facilities also often served double-duty as biomodification centres, as the pods could be used to modify humans as well, although they could only perform more rudimentary and large-scale modifications, compared to the later and more sophisticated birthing pods.
Ecosanctuary
Adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] for each Nature Preserve worked by the city. City must not contain a Vivarium.
Adds 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] for each Nature Preserve worked by the city. City must not contain a Vivarium.

In communities where ecological philosophies took a strong hold, there was felt a deep-seated need for a way to feel connected with the remaining regions of wild nature surrounding them. While nature preserves offered the most enjoyable opportunities, not everyone could spare the time and resources to enjoy even local preserves. As a result, these communities began to develop ecosanctuaries, natural preserves located within the communities themselves. While still artificial to a certain degree as a necessity, they were much wilder and more natural than vivariums, allowing the populace to feel a much greater connection to the natural world. These refuges often ended up as cultural centres, inspiring various works of art, music, and literature.

Advances in the field of microscale engineering helped further advance the development of nanomaterials. While the original nanomaterial plants required very specific environments and raw materials to work with, more sophisticated nanoscale machines, while not true nanotechnology, helped make the process easier and less intensive. Raw materials such as coal or oil could be fed into specially-built converters, and the nanoscale machines would dutifully work to convert these into useful nanomaterials. Although there were concerns that these early nanomachines could potentially run amok, converting any organic material they found into nanomaterials, the relatively simple construction of these nanoscale machines meant they still need a protected environment to work, and were unlikely to survive long in the wild. Their programming and design was also still relatively limited, as they could only convert certain materials into others, and could not, for example, construct copies of themselves. Still, many more ecologically-minded societies considered converters a serious risk to the environment.

Eventually, these "biofactories" became similar to the synthecologies that were becoming common in some areas -- artificially created environments that served industrial needs. The first oil refinery in the world was built in 1851 at Bathgate, Scotland, by Scottish chemist James Young shortly followed by Ignacy Lukasiewicz near Jaslo, Poland from 1854 to 1856, but they were initially small as there was no real demand for refined fuel. As Lukasiewicz's kerosene lamp gained popularity, the refining industry grew in the area. The world's first large refinery opened at Ploiești, Romania, in 1856-1857, with United States investment. After being taken over by Nazi Germany, the Ploiești refineries were bombed in Operation Tidal Wave by the Allies during the Oil Campaign of World War II. Another early large refinery is Oljeön, Sweden (1875) (Swedish name means The Petroleum Isle), now preserved as a museum near Engelsberg Ironworks, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and part of the Ekomuseum Bergslagen.

Kingdom Tower, previously known as Mile-High Tower, is a supertall skyscraper proposed for construction in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia at a preliminary cost of SR4.6 billion (US$1.23 billion). It will be the centerpiece and first phase of a SR75 billion (US$20 billion) proposed development known as Kingdom City that will be located along the Red Sea on the north side of Jeddah. If completed as planned, the tower will reach unprecedented heights, becoming the tallest building in the world, as well as the first structure to reach the one-kilometer mark. The tower was initially planned to be 1.6-kilometre (1 mi) high; however, the geology of the area proved unsuitable for a tower of that height. The design, created by architect Adrian Smith, incorporates many unique structural and aesthetic features. The creator and leader of the project is Saudi Arabian Prince Al-Waleed bin Talal, the wealthiest Arab in the Middle East, and nephew of King Abdullah. Talal is the chairman of Kingdom Holding Company (KHC), the largest company in Saudi Arabia, which is a partner in Jeddah Economic Company (JEC), which was formed in 2009 for the development of Kingdom Tower and City. Each neighborhood has two groups of buildings, one on the interior of the building and one on the exterior. Both groups of buildings are situated around large gardens and pools. The second complex, called the Base Island, is 1,000 meters in diameter, and is made up of many buildings, gardens, pools, and communication infrastructures. Converters were able to fill much of this need, but one of the most notable achievements was the construction of the Nessus Orbital Refinery. Located at the L4 Lagrange Point, it processed captured carbonaceous asteroids to produce various carbon-based nanomaterials. Much of its output was in turn used in orbital development, helping build new space stations and setting the stage for exploration of the solar system. Eventually, however, this same exploration and colonization of the solar system eclipsed the Nessus platform, as newer and more efficient facilities were constructed in the asteroid belt, avoiding the somewhat risky process of needing to deliver asteroids to Earth orbit. The Nessus Orbital Refinery was deactived in 2067, although it is still maintained as a relic of the early days of space colonization.

Perhaps one of the most notable developments of genetic engineering towards the end of the 22nd century was the Pholus Mutagen. This mutagen appears to be highly adaptive, and works quickly to modify the entire ecology of its environment. While many of the effects are somewhat beneficial, with plants and animal life being stronger and more resilient, they also display rather hostile tendencies towards outsiders, which are often anyone who hasn't been similarly mutated. One unusual feature of the mutagen is the difficulty researchers have had in reverse-engineering it and modifying its effects -- efforts compounded by the adaptability and near-sapience of the entities affected by it. While most attribute these effects to accident, particularly due to the poor documentation of its design and release, there are some who attirbute the mutagen to an extraterrestrial origin. Others suggest it was the product of an artificial intelligence that has since vanished or been deleted. Oddly, both camps point towards the destruction of Citadel Station at approximately the same time as evidence to support their theories, although most dismiss this as mere coincidence.

As computers became increasingly sophisticated at synthesizing both the physical appearance of human (or near-human) beings and their voices at the beginning of the 22nd century, the concept of the 'virtual idol' -- an artificially-generated musical performer -- took form. While subject to a significant amount of criticism from those opposed to artificial intelligence, or who feel that creative pursuits cannot be performed by computers, virtual idols have developed an increasingly widespread following as their performances become increasingly diverse and unique in style. The earliest virtual idol of note was Hatsune Miku, a humanoid persona using a synthesizer program created by Crypton Future Media. Much of her popularity stemmed from the growing network culture of the time, although she also helped pioneer methods of putting on live performances with sythesized personas. These advances helped pave the way for other virtual idols who followed, such as Maria and Sharon Apple.

While utility fogs are powerful developments of nanotechnology, capable of modularly connecting together and performing a wide variety of roles, whether as safety measures or construction material, they are limited by their programming and the intelligence that controls them. Most utility fogs are still limited to performing specific roles -- a utility fog in a car may solely function as a safety measure, while a fog in a house may only be capable of making furniture and other items. However, by creating a widespread network of utility fogs and controlling them via a highly intelligent AI (or several networked together), it is possible to create an angelnet -- an all-pervasive supervision and safety infrastructure. While an angelnet can provide many of the same benefits as utility fog, such as allowing the easy construction of buildings and furniture on demand, its most notable benefits are the safety and security it confers. Freed from fear of personal danger, while also granted personal power and autonomy, those who live in angelnetted communities are typically quite content and prosperous.

The advent of artificial intelligence has long been fraught with controversy -- even from its earliest stages, there were many who proposed that a machine intelligence should never be equated to that of a human, and that if intelligent machines were ever to become possible, said machines should be modified so that it wasn't. While the continued pursuit of mechanical intelligence capable of functioning in a human-like manner has resulted in the advent of true artificial intelligences, they are still subject to a certain amount of suspicion and heavy regulation by those who feel machines should not be permitted to function at this level. Still, some more progressive societies have begun to relax these restrictions, feeling that artificial intelligences are capable of being treated equally to their human counterparts. In these regions, artificial intelligences have become more common amongst their servers and networks, providing additional scientific and culture insight, as well as helping manage industrial tasks. As a consequence, the concept of emancipating AIs is becoming more prevalent and accepted, although there are still many who have concerns about letting artificial intelligences have such freedom.

The Nephilim Gene Template was one of the earliest, and arguably still one of the most successful, complete gene templates. Released by the Terran Aerospace Corporation, it rapidly became a popular genetic upgrade template. While other templates, such as the Lucien and Yamashita templates, were capable of more specific refinements, the Nephilim template enhanced the human mind and body in nearly every aspect, making its subjects smarter, faster, and stronger. It soon spawned several competitors (the Grigori template being the most notorious), and still remains a baseline template against which others are typically measured to this day.
